item.description:
EVENT: The Yiddish Book Center is a non-profit organization working to tell the whole Jewish story by rescuing, translating and disseminating Yiddish books and presenting innovative educational programs that broaden understanding of modern Jewish identity. It's located on the campus of Hampshire College.  Directions are on the website.

We will meet at the Yiddush Book Center in Amherst Ma at 12:10pm, tour the center with a guided tour until 1:15, have lunch on the picnic tables outside and then see a Jewish film from Argentina at 2pm at the center.  You can go to http://support.yiddishbookcenter.org/site/Calendar/1315787327?view=Detail&id=4561 to  find out about the film and the Yiddush Book Center.  After the film we can decide if we want to walk around the campus or check out more of the center. Please bring lunch.

Trip’s Coordinator: Heather, hplatt@mosaicofmass.org
RSVP: Required by Saturday July 28 at 6pm
MEET: We will meet at the entrance to the Center.  I can help with letting others know if you want to carpool.  Please send me your phone number so that I can call you if we can't find each other at the meet place.
COST: Tour is free. Movie is $8 and you can purchase tickets online if you want to at the above link.  Or you can buy them when you get there.  $5 for Non-members that can be credited towards a full membership of $25.
item.how_to_find_us: Contact the Trip's Coordinator for plans for meeting

group.name: Mosaic Jewish Outdoor Club of Massachusetts

item.name: Tour and Movie at the Yiddish Book Center
